title: Joeyp
author: Joeyp
content: Bitcointalk forum needs dark mode. Many popular websites already have it, for example, youtube. People love dark mode, plus members can browse forum without straining their eyes.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: You can use any of these extension for night modeDark theme for Bitcointalk(CSS only)Bitcointalk Dark ThemeBitcointalk Dark ThemeOn mobile:If you can use mobile browser like Via, Phoenix or UC browser, they all have night mode.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Op, if you had done your research well, you would have known by now, that there's a whole thread containing List of Bitcointalk.org Userscripts/ Add-ons / SMF patchesNot all members would love to use the dark theme here on Bitcoin talk. I myself prefer the light theme. If you so want to use it then you can try it out. Here's a link to the script Bitcointalk Dark Theme.You can install it on a browsers that support  extensions. On Android you can try using wiki browser  or UC browser while on windows it's supported by chrome so you just have to download it

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: Joeyp on September 16, 2023, 06:53:38 PMBitcointalk forum needs dark mode. Many popular websites already have it, for example, youtube. People love dark mode, plus members can browse forum without straining their eyes.Bitcointalk is not like other "popular" websites. Maybe it can't even be called popular, because ordinary users rarely come (or stay) here. Simply put, this forum is not as useful to everyone as YouTube or the like.Before I came to Bitcointalk, I followed some very good forums that also worked on SMF, for me, this look is quite enough, and maybe it's just a matter of habit.

comments.body: Quote from: Joeyp on September 16, 2023, 07:10:43 PMQuote from: _act_ on September 16, 2023, 06:58:19 PMWhen webpage have dark/light mode, it is always better than any addon. Just check youtube dark mode. Are you looking for the forum to look like YouTube? Or you want dark mode because of the strains the current light mode causes to your eyes?You have given multiple choices here on how you can use the forum on dark mode so I don’t see any reason why you’re still dragging YouTube into the discussion, if you so much like YouTube’s dark mode then you might as well just stay there. Currently there’s no inbuilt dark mode the only way you can use it is either you use a browser that has a dark mode feature or you install extensions or run the script in your tampermonkey.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Joeyp on September 16, 2023, 09:35:05 PMQuote from: philipma1957 on September 16, 2023, 09:00:16 PM-snip-Of course Bitcointalk forum needs two modes - light and dark. Bitcointalk is old - although improvements such as mode features are also expected, but you can expect them to be implemented in EpochTalk. There are many improvements that users expect from bitcointalk - but they realize that they cannot be realized easily. The main solution is to use help from a third party - that will help you for now until there is an official upgrade on the forum.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: I cannot say I concur when you state the forum needs dark mode because I in my opinion your view is subjective. Nevertheless it would probably be considered as one of many feature requests and assessed by theymos. I doubt it will gain traction though but if you feel strongly about the issue you raise, you could consider adding a poll in order to see what the community thinks about it.Quote from: Joeyp on September 16, 2023, 06:53:38 PMBitcointalk forum needs dark mode. Many popular websites already have it, for example, youtube. People love dark mode, plus members can browse forum without straining their eyes.
